item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Florida Gators top USA Today coaches' preseason poll
item.description: Defending national champion Florida tops the USA Today preseason football coaches' poll, receiving 53 of 59 first-place votes.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Cleveland Cavaliers' LeBron James unlikely to accept contract extension
item.description: LeBron James is unlikely to accept a contract extension from the Cleveland Cavaliers until after the 2009-10 season, when he can become a free agent.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Injured San Francisco 49ers receiver Brandon Jones to miss 2 months
item.description: San Francisco 49ers receiver Brandon Jones is expected to miss two months because of a fracture in his right shoulder, coach Mike Singletary said Friday.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: John Smoltz designated for assignment by Boston Red Sox
item.description: The Boston Red Sox have designated John Smoltz for assignment, one day after the right-hander was tagged for eight runs and nine hits in 3 1/3 innings in a 13-6 loss to the Yankees.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Minnesota Twins get Carl Pavano from Cleveland Indians, demote R.A. Dickey
item.description: The Minnesota Twins have acquired right-hander Carl Pavano from the Cleveland Indians in an attempt to shore up their rotation.

item.dc:creator: Chad Ford
item.title: Source: Ben Wallace, Detroit Pistons agree on one-year deal
item.description: Free agent center Ben Wallace agreed to terms with the Pistons on Friday, according to a league source.

item.dc:creator: Buster Olney
item.title: Sources: Waiver claim made on Alex Rios of Toronto Blue Jays
item.description: A waiver claim has been placed on Blue Jays right fielder Alex Rios, according to MLB sources.

item.dc:creator: Bob Harig
item.title: Tiger Woods faces his biggest Bridgestone Invitational deficit after 36 holes
item.description: Tiger Woods will need to overcome his biggest 36-hole deficit at the WGC-Bridgestone Invitational if he is to win the tournament for the seventh time.

item.dc:creator: External
item.title: Bradley names U.S. roster vs. Mexico

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Jay Cutler rates Chicago Bears fans over Denver Broncos fans; Kyle Orton booed at practice
item.description: Jay Cutler and Kyle Orton are both getting to understand the fans of their new teams are passionate about football -- but for very different reasons.

item.dc:creator: Dana O'Neil
item.title: Dominique Ferguson makes verbal commitment to Florida International Golden Panthers
item.description: In a decision sure to stun many in the basketball community, Dominique Ferguson, rated the No. 8 rising senior in the ESPN 100, gave a verbal commitment to Florida International on Friday.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Appalachian State Mountaineers' Armanti Edwards injures foot while mowing lawn
item.description: Appalachian State starting quarterback Armanti Edwards will miss two to four weeks after injuring his right foot in a mowing accident, a school spokesman confirmed Friday.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: NBA free agents: Miami Heat reportedly still interested in Allen Iverson's services
item.description: The Miami Heat supposedly haven't cooled on the idea of adding Allen Iverson to next season's roster.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Orlando Magic's Rashard Lewis suspended for failing drug test
item.description: All-Star forward Rashard Lewis of the Orlando Magic has been suspended without pay for 10 games for testing positive for an elevated testosterone level, the league announced Thursday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Major League Baseball fines Prince Fielder, Guillermo Mota; no suspensions
item.description: Prince Fielder and Guillermo Mota have been fined for their run-in this week.
